edu.ata.user

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ata.user.Logger

  • public class Logger
extends Object
    Logging class. Used to give messages to user in different ways depending on urgency.

    There is a fake Logger.Urgency class that holds urgency types. As we use java source 1.3/1.4, we cannot use enums.

    Note that all logs are automatically sent to file:///log.txt unless otherwise set. See setFileLoggingOn(boolean).

    Author:
    Joel Gallant

        public Logger()

    • Method Detail

      • log

        public static void log(Logger.Urgency urgency,
       String msg)
        Logs a message, and depending on the urgency given, reacts appropriately.

        By default, sends messages to the log file at file:///log.txt.

        Parameters:
        urgency - Urgency of the log. Urgencies are available as static variables in the Log class.
        msg - Message to send to the user.

      • logFile

        public static void logFile(String msg)
                    throws IOException
        Logs a message to the log file.
        Parameters:
        msg - message to write
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown when writing throws an error

      • appendToFile

        public static void appendToFile(String msg,
                FileConnection fileConnection)
                         throws IOException
        Adds a new part to a text file.
        Parameters:
        msg - message to add
        fileConnection - connection to the file
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown when problem writing occurs

      • getLog

        public static String getLog()
                     throws IOException
        Gets the contents of the log file. Goes through each character and concats it to the string. Is inefficient, so feel free to make it work faster (Test changes, reading without parsing is difficult).
        Returns:
        contents of log
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown when problem connecting occurs

      • getTextFromFile

        public static String getTextFromFile(FileConnection fileConnection)
                              throws IOException
        Returns text from a file, using FileConnection.
        Parameters:
        fileConnection - connection to the file
        Returns:
        string representation of contents of the file
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown when file occurs a problem

      • displayLCDMessage

        public static void displayLCDMessage(String msg)
        Displays a message on the DriverStation LCD. Is convenience method for DriverStationLCD.

        This method should usually not be called. log(edu.ata.user.Logger.Urgency, java.lang.String) provides a better solution to displaying information to the user. This method is available for public use just in case (It can't hurt).

        Parameters:
        msg - message to display to the user

      • setFileLoggingOn

        public static void setFileLoggingOn(boolean fileLoggingOn)
        Sets log(edu.ata.user.Logger.Urgency, java.lang.String) to automatically send messages to the log file (file:///log.txt). By default, is on.
        Parameters:
        fileLoggingOn - whether to log files

      • isFileLoggingOn

        public static boolean isFileLoggingOn()
        Returns whether log(edu.ata.user.Logger.Urgency, java.lang.String) is automatically sending messages to the log file (file:///log.txt). By default, is on.
        Returns:
        whether logs are being saved to the log file
